intro: Sopubia kacondensis, commonly known as the Kacondé dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Sopubia kacondensis is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
